alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 11:21PM EDT until July 24 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Forsyth County in central North Carolina... Northeastern Davidson County in central North Carolina... Northwestern Randolph County in central North Carolina... Southwestern Guilford County in central North Carolina... * Until midnight EDT. * At 1120 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near High Point, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Greensboro, High Point, Thomasville, Kernersville, Archdale, Trinity, Pleasant Garden, Jamestown, Randleman Regional Reservior Marina and Oak Hollow Marina. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
